channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Overhanging tree to almost the middle of the road and tree at least 70 feet tall with dead area in the middle, 3rd September
item.description:
There has been no trimming of the overgrown trees within the 28 days notice you gave as per reference 7889136 The needles being shed are beginning to block the drain again. I am concerned that the tree could fall and injure members of the public walking by
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Silverdale Road, Petts Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree fallen onto pavement, 3rd September
item.description:
On Green Dale opposite JAGS school, tree has fallen onto the pavement today. Branches have been cleared from cycle path but pavement is obstructed

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Green Dale, Dulwich Village, London

item.title: Bus stand South side, 3rd September
item.description:
Apologies - it's the south side that I think the road marking is incorrect. On the north side, there is a bus stop AND a bus stand - correctly marked in two parts. On the south side of Russell Square, there is a Bus Stand (see flag sign) but the bay is incorrectly marked as BUS STOP (please see attached image). Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Russell Square, Bloomsbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Item attached to lamp post without planning permission, 3rd September
item.description:
These flags have been placed on lamp posts illegally as under Section 132 of the Highways Act 1980, it is unlawful to attach items like flags to lamp posts without council permission. Additionally, under Section 224 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990, these flags count as advertisements and require your consent. If the council is aware and does nothing, it could be held responsible. Beyond the legal issues, they present clear public safety risks: they could fall, obstruct visibility, or interfere with lighting and maintenance. Other councils, including Tower Hamlets and Birmingham, have already removed similar flags on exactly these grounds. I therefore request that Greenwich Council take prompt action to remove them.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 401, Footscray Road, New Eltham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flags hung around roundabout distracting while driving, 3rd September
item.description:

item.title: Fly tipping, 3rd September

item.title: Fraudulent Clothing Bin, 3rd September
item.description:
This yellow bin has been dumped in the growing bed at the corner of Wordsworth & Bennett Roads since at least 22 August. Claims to be a local charity but is not registered as a charity. Unclear whether Council authorised and possibly fraudulent.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wordsworth Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
